name: Lansallos coastal and woodland walk, Mid and SE Cornwall

ai.summary: A scenic 14.1 km moderate hike along the Cornwall coast and surrounding woodlands, starting near Lansallos and looping through clifftop paths, beaches, and shady woodland trails with sea views.
ai.terrain_summary: Combination of clifftop coastal paths, hedge-lined tracks, woodland trails, and some stone steps. Expect uneven surfaces, exposed cliff sections, and occasional mud after rain. Sturdy boots and a map are recommended.
ai.safety_notes: Check tide times before coastal sections. Stay well back from cliff edges and keep dogs under control. Weather can change quickly; bring layers, waterproofs, and sun protection. Carry a map or GPS, a whistle, water, and snacks; inform someone of your planned route and route timing.
recommended_gear: Sturdy hiking boots with good grip
Weather-appropriate clothing (layers with a waterproof jacket)
Windproof layer and sun protection (hat, sunscreen)
Map, compass, or fully charged smartphone with offline map
Small first aid kit and whistle
Headlamp or flashlight (in case of late finish)
ai.best_seasons: Spring to autumn (roughly March–October) for milder weather and better coastal views; winter can be windy and damp.

seo.title: Lansallos Coastal and Woodland Walk – 14.1 km Moderate Hike in Cornwall, UK
seo.meta_description: Discover the Lansallos coastal and woodland walk, a 14.1 km moderate coastal hike in Cornwall. Coastal views, woodland trails, safety tips, best seasons, and gear.
